value.title: NVIDIA Intros Jetson Nano 2GB Developer Kit for AI and Robotics Ed
value.excerpt: NVIDIA has introduced its new Jetson Nano 2GB Developer Kit, a new system designed for “learning, building and teaching AI and robotics.” The Linux-based system is built around a 128-core NVIDIA Maxwell GPU and a 1.43 GHz quad-core ARM A57 CPU.

value.title: Robot boats from MIT can now carry passengers
value.excerpt: The latest "Roboat" is an autonomous vehicle that's about six feet long and is being tested for use in Amsterdam.

value.title: 7 AI Stocks to Buy as Automation Advances
value.excerpt: Oxford academics Carl Benedikt Frey and Michael Osborne estimated that 47% of American jobs are at high risk of automation by the mid-2030s, so it’s closer than we think. Many investors aren’t sure what the technology is or what AI stocks to buy in anticipation of its rise.

value.title: The best robo-advisors of November 2020
value.excerpt: Robo-advisors are online financial investment platforms that create and manage an investment portfolio based on your individual needs and financial goals, no human advisor required. You don't need to have a lot of investing know-how.

value.title: With Industrial Robots Easier Than Ever To Program, How Do Our Attitudes Toward Automation Adapt?
value.excerpt: Whether it's which tasks we can automate, the cost and time necessary for robot automation or how workers can contribute, the rise of easy-to-program robots forces us to rethink our assumptions and strategies for robotic automation.

value.title: AI-Powered Trading Platform Tickeron Releases New Swing Trading AI Robots

value.title: U.S. Lost Over 60 Million Jobs—Now Robots, Tech And Artificial Intelligence Will Take Millions More
value.excerpt: The World Economic Forum (WEF) concluded in a recent report that “a new generation of smart machines, fueled by rapid advances in artificial intelligence (AI) and robotics, could potentially replace a large proportion of existing human jobs.”

value.title: Per Aspera has you tame Mars with cute little robots

value.title: Pandemic speeds labour shift from humans to robots, WEF survey finds
value.excerpt: Robots will destroy 85 million jobs at mid-sized to large businesses over the next five years as the COVID-19 pandemic accelerates changes in the workplace likely to exaggerate inequalities, a World Economic Forum (WEF) study has found.

value.title: iRobot Q3 surges amid direct sales, e-commerce and home robot demand
